1.text: A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.

2.text: The tongue of the wise commends knowledge, but the mouth of the fool spouts folly.

3.text: The eyes of the LORD are in every place, observing the evil and the good.

4.text: A soothing tongue is a tree of life, but a perverse tongue crushes the spirit.

5.text: A fool rejects his father’s discipline, but whoever heeds correction is prudent.

6.text: The house of the righteous has great treasure, but the income of the wicked is trouble.

7.text: The lips of the wise spread knowledge, but not so the hearts of fools.

8.text: The sacrifice of the wicked is detestable to the LORD, but the prayer of the upright is His delight.

9.text: The LORD detests the way of the wicked, but He loves those who pursue righteousness.

10.text: Discipline is harsh for him who leaves the path; he who hates correction will die.

11.text: Sheol and Abaddon lie open before the LORD—how much more the hearts of men!

12.text: A mocker does not love to be reproved, nor will he consult the wise.

13.text: A joyful heart makes a cheerful countenance, but sorrow of the heart crushes the spirit.

14.text: A discerning heart seeks knowledge, but the mouth of a fool feeds on folly.

15.text: All the days of the oppressed are bad, but a cheerful heart has a continual feast.

16.text: Better a little with the fear of the LORD than great treasure with turmoil.

17.text: Better a dish of vegetables where there is love than a fattened ox with hatred.

18.text: A hot-tempered man stirs up strife, but he who is slow to anger calms dispute.

19.text: The way of the slacker is like a hedge of thorns, but the path of the upright is a highway.

20.text: A wise son brings joy to his father, but a foolish man despises his mother.

21.text: Folly is joy to one who lacks judgment, but a man of understanding walks a straight path.

22.text: Plans fail for lack of counsel, but with many advisers they succeed.

23.text: A man takes joy in a fitting reply—and how good is a timely word!

24.text: The path of life leads upward for the wise, that he may avoid going down to Sheol.

25.text: The LORD tears down the house of the proud, but He protects the boundaries of the widow.

26.text: The LORD detests the thoughts of the wicked, but the words of the pure are pleasant to Him.

27.text: He who is greedy for unjust gain brings trouble on his household, but he who hates bribes will live.

28.text: The heart of the righteous ponders how to answer, but the mouth of the wicked blurts out evil.

29.text: The LORD is far from the wicked, but He hears the prayer of the righteous.

30.text: The light of the eyes cheers the heart, and good news nourishes the bones.

31.text: He who listens to life-giving reproof will dwell among the wise.

32.text: He who ignores discipline despises himself, but whoever heeds correction gains understanding.

33.text: The fear of the LORD is the instruction of wisdom, and humility comes before honor.
